definition: to delist (a traded security)/(sports) to accept a transfer-listed player from another club
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)

sentences.english: After the acquisition, Citigroup would delist the company from Indian bourses .
sentences.chinese: 完成收购后，它将从印度股市中摘牌。

sentences.english: But as of this week, it was still unaccredited.
sentences.chinese: 但到本周，它仍然处于摘牌状态。

sentences.english: Its shares have been delisted from the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.chinese: 该公司股票已经被纽约证券交易所摘牌。

definition: lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
